My Story

I'm a passionate Software Engineer currently working at Anthropic in the San Francisco Bay Area, where I build systems that serve millions of users worldwide. My journey in technology has been driven by curiosity and a passion for creating innovative solutions to real-world problems.

Educational Background

I hold a graduate degree from the University of California, San Diego, and completed my undergraduate studies at R.V. College of Engineering in Bangalore. My academic journey provided a strong foundation in computer science fundamentals and advanced topics.

Professional Experience

At Anthropic, my expertise lies in algorithm design, scalable system architecture, and machine learning applications. I have a patent filed for "System and method for logistical assistance with data exchange," reflecting my commitment to innovative problem-solving in the logistics domain.

Achievements & Recognition

Programming Contests

Multiple awards in ACM ICPC and IEEE XTREME competitions

Logistical data exchange systems innovation

Professional Memberships

Active member of ACM, IEEE, and IAENG

Languages & Cultural Background

I'm multilingual, speaking English, Hindi, and Marwadi natively, with elementary proficiency in Kannada. This linguistic diversity helps me connect with people from various backgrounds and cultures, bringing a global perspective to my work.
